item.title: 'Bloodbath' at Washington Post as massive layoffs announced
item.description: The Jeff Bezos-owned paper, which famously brought down US President Richard Nixon, will drastically cut back in size and lay off workers in all its departments.

item.title: A 'ghost airport' and sinkhole highway as Timor-Leste gambles on oil and gas with Greater Sunrise project
item.description: The Greater Sunrise gas project was meant to transform Timor-Leste and bring billions in revenue, but locals are still waiting for the jobs and opportunities that were promised.

item.title: Online safety watchdog says tech giants failing to detect child abuse
item.description: Major tech companies including Apple, Google, Meta and Microsoft are still failing to do enough to detect and stop child sexual abuse, eSafety has claimed.

item.title: Report points to exploitation, Medicare and visa concerns in Pacific islander jobs scheme
item.description: Changing jobs is a basic right for most people, but it is not so simple for Pacific Australia Labour Mobility workers.

item.title: In Zak Hilditch's horror movie We Bury the Dead, the zombie apocalypse devastates Tasmania
item.description: These Final Hours writer and director Zak Hilditch drew on personal tragedy to produce We Bury the Dead, his biggest cinematic epic yet.

item.title: Report calls for Australia to grow security, trade and diplomatic ties with Taiwan because of China's influence
item.description: Experts say Australia needs to do more to grow its relationship with Taiwan as China works to diplomatically isolate Taipei in the region.

item.title: Fears SA's endangered glossy black-cockatoo eggs will 'cook' in nesting boxes during heatwave
item.description: South Australia's population of a unique subspecies of glossy black-cockatoos is heavily dependent on artificial nesting boxes. That could pose a problem during extreme heat conditions.

item.title: Mother shares concerns about treatment at Toowoomba Hospital amid culture review
item.description: A confrontation caught on body-worn security footage in the halls of the Toowoomba Hospital maternity unit highlights concerns raised by local mothers.

item.description: A man accused of mimicking firing on people near the pedestrian bridge where the Bondi terror attack occurred has been denied bail.

item.title: Parramatta Eels veteran Josh Addo-Carr urges young teammates to step up after Zac Lomax depature
item.description: Parramatta's next generation of outside backs must step up if they are to fill the void left by Zac Lomax, his ex-teammate Josh Addo-Carr has said.

item.title: 'Ironic' and 'lazy' AI-generated images shared on Queensland government department social media accounts
item.description: A Queensland government department has urged social media users not to trust AI through the use of an AI-generated image.

item.title: Pauline Hanson returns to Senate seat after seven-day suspension — as it happened
item.description: One Nation Leader Pauline Hanson has returned to her seat in the Senate after she was suspended for seven sitting days.

item.title: What are data centres and what do they mean for regional Victoria?
item.description: With the announcement of two new facilities outside of Melbourne, could regional Victoria become a hotspot for data centres?

item.title: Authorities say Appelbee family's rescue highlights unexpected dangers in WA's South West
item.description: Marine Rescue workers tasked with monitoring WA's Geographe Bay say last week's astonishing rescue of a Perth family highlights the dangers facing tourists.

item.title: Police launch investigation into sudden death in Toowoomba
item.description: Police have closed part of Bell Street and the Toowoomba bus terminal car park on Chronicle Lane in Toowoomba's CBD as part of the investigation.

item.title: What is the difference between a tropical low and cyclone in northern Australia?
item.description: Tropical lows are weaker than tropical cyclones, but a meteorologist explains they can still cause significant damage.

item.title: Central Queensland conservation group wants to see more transparency on coal mine water releases
item.description: There were 55 water releases from the region's coal mines in the month of January into the largest catchment draining to the Great Barrier Reef.

item.title: Homeless Whitsunday boaties begin long rebuild after Tropical Cyclone Koji carnage
item.description: Around a dozen boats recovered by Marine Safety Queensland were part-time or permanent liveaboard boats, with boaties in the Whitsundays facing a long journey to find a new permanent home on or off the water.

item.title: Donald Trump, gold, interest rates and AI data centres to dominate company reporting season
item.description: Australia's mining sector is expected to lead the earnings charge for this reporting season, boosted by signs of a stabilisation in the Chinese economy and a turbo-charged commodities market.

item.title: NRL rookie Sebastian Su'a poised for breakout year after injury-plagued 2025 season with Dolphins
item.description: The work ethic of a former Test fast bowler and the mentoring of an elite prop are inspiring Dolphins rookie Sebastian Su'a's NRL quest.

item.title: Sydney man, 19, charged over alleged threats to kill Israeli president
item.description: Darcy Tinning was arrested by AFP officers on Wednesday and charged with making a threat to kill an "internationally protected person".

item.title: Worker's death at Tanami gold mine in Central Australia under investigation
item.description: A 47-year-old worker has died following an incident at the Tanami gold mine in remote Central Australia, with police and NT WorkSafe investigating.

item.title: New resource connects people with organisations on front lines of bushfire relief effort
item.description: A new online resource aims to make it easier for people to contribute to bushfire relief efforts across Victoria.

item.title: Police executing drug raid find deadly snakes, crocodile in alleged makeshift zoo
item.description: More than 50 reptiles, including a 1.3-metre crocodile, have been seized after police discovered an alleged makeshift zoo during a drug raid on the NSW Mid North Coast.

item.title: Australians in Japan say ski fields are safe after spate of deaths
item.description: Australians working in Japan's ski fields say while the sport has unpredictable risks, there are ways to be prepared.

item.title: Queensland man charged after police allege 23,000 files of child abuse seized
item.description: A Queensland man has been charged with 596 child abuse-related offences after he allegedly "groomed, coerced and threatened" hundreds of young people.

item.title: Two people in custody after alleged Huon Valley home invasion
item.description: Police take two people into custody in relation to an alleged early morning home invasion and firearms theft in the Huon Valley.

item.title: State of Origin 2027 in New Zealand hailed as a boost for rugby league by Kiwi great
item.description: The NRL's reported landmark move to host a State of Origin match in New Zealand is hailed as "sensational" by Kiwi legend Gary Freeman.

item.title: Gus disappearance declared major crime, suspect identified
item.description: South Australian police have declared the disappearance of Gus Lamont a major crime and say a person who has lived at his outback property is now considered a suspect, but have stressed that the boy's parents are not under investigation.

item.title: Invasion Day bomb declared terror act, as accused's 'pro-white ideology' probed
item.description: The attempted bombing of an Invasion Day rally in Perth's CBD last week is declared a terrorist attack by authorities.

item.title: Strict caps on bottled water extraction urged for World Heritage-listed Springbrook
item.description: A long-awaited study warns that the extraction of bottled water from the World Heritage-listed Springbrook area poses a potential risk to the ancient Gondwana rainforests and should be strictly limited.

item.title: Private health insurers take aim at rising specialists fees
item.description: A survey of 4,000 patients finds more than half had an unexpected cost when under a specialist's care.

item.title: AFL integrity unit looking into why police visited Melbourne Demons player Steven May
item.description: Melbourne veteran Steven May is being investigated by the AFL integrity unit, as the premiership defender stays away from Demons training.

item.title: ACTU pushing 'above-inflation' wage increase in 2026 as real paypackets decline
item.description: Australia's biggest employers are under pressure to give their workers pay increases above 4 per cent this year, as real wages go backwards and the union movement ramps up pressure.

item.title: Families respond after Westfield Bondi Junction stabbing inquest findings released
item.description: Loved ones of victims Ashlee Good and Jade Young have fought back tears responding to findings from the high-profile inquest into the Westfield Bondi Junction stabbing.

item.title: Andrew Hastie reads Art of War, Pauline Hanson returns
item.description: The calamity unfolding in the dissolved Coalition provided a convenient distraction for the government, which should have had a worse week amid an interest rate hike.

item.title: Mother of autistic children shares experience in wake of suspected double murder-suicide
item.description: A mother of two autistic children living in regional Western Australia has shared her experience of navigating bureaucracy while caring for children with complex needs.

item.title: Lockhart River Mayor Wayne William Butcher pleads guilty to Cairns bail breach
item.description: A Far North Queensland mayor has pleaded guilty to two counts of breaching his bail conditions after he was found drinking tea in a casino with a person he must avoid.

item.title: Old Spirit ferries up sale with new berth 'on track' for October launch, TT-Line says
item.description: Ferry operator TT-Line is confident its two new Spirit of Tasmania vessels will begin operating by October — but it says there is a "risk" its existing ships might not be sold by then.

item.title: More than 200 Daly River residents evacuated amid flood threat, with most staying at Darwin's Foskey Pavilion
item.description: Hundreds of Daly River residents have been evacuated to Darwin ahead of expected major flooding, with Foskey Pavilion set up to accommodate most of the evacuees.

item.title: Melbourne public housing tower residents win injunction against eviction notices ahead of High Court bid
item.description: Homes Victoria will be temporarily halted from evicting remaining residents at three Melbourne public housing towers in Flemington and North Melbourne, after an injunction was issued in Victoria's Court of Appeal.

item.title: Bunnings wins fight to use AI facial recognition tech to combat store crime, opening door for other retailers
item.description: Bunnings was reasonably entitled to use AI facial recognition technology to combat crime and staff abuse in its stores, the Administrative Review Tribunal finds.

item.title: Murray-Darling Basin Authority hands down discussion paper ahead of first review in 14 years
item.description: The Murray-Darling Basin Authority says the basin plan has delivered real benefits, but climate change, disconnected floodplains and poor water quality mean things still need to change.

item.title: NSW government contacts Newcastle Writers Festival about author Randa Abdel-Fattah's inclusion
item.description: The NSW government makes contact with the board of next month's Newcastle Writers Festival about the inclusion of Palestinian-Australian author Randa Abdel-Fattah, the ABC understands.

item.title: Albanese, Ley condemn alleged act of terror targeting Indigenous protesters
item.description: The prime minister and opposition leader have both condemned the alleged attempted bombing of an Invasion Day rally more than a week ago, after police revealed it was being prosecuted as a terror incident.

item.title: Democrat victory in Republican stronghold could spell trouble for Trump
item.description: The US has been gripped by cold weather in recent weeks, but pundits say it is in Texas where hell has truly frozen over. A blue wave just swept a GOP stronghold, and Republicans are very worried.

item.title: Gus Lamont disappearance from Oak Park Station near Yunta: What has happened so far
item.description: It is now more than four months since Gus Lamont went missing from his family's home in South Australia's outback, with the case being declared a major crime on Thursday. Here's what has happened so far.

item.title: How capital gains tax changes could impact you
item.description: According to a well-sourced leak, changes to capital gains tax discounts could form the centrepiece of the next federal budget in May. And while the government has downplayed the idea, it has not been ruled out.

item.title: Union urges Sanjeev Gupta to sell Tahmoor mine as $350m offer revealed
item.description: The Mining and Energy Union says a firm $350 million offer is on the table to restart Tahmoor Colliery, warning delays risk the mine's future and hundreds of jobs.

item.title: Man convicted of grooming one girl and raping another at Canberra Reptile Zoo
item.description: A 26-year-old man has been convicted in the ACT Supreme Court of sexually assaulting two girls at Canberra Reptile Zoo.

item.title: Coroner recommends Ambulance Victoria guideline review following nut allergy death of Max McKenzie
item.description: The coroner could not definitively rule that the anaphylaxis death of 15-year-old Max McKenzie was preventable, despite identifying delays in the teen's medical treatment.

item.description: News from the world of finance and business. Top stories in text, video and audio. Business video news bulletin. Features and analysis.

item.title: Alleged attempted murder victim gives evidence in Shaun Michael Dunk trial
item.description: A woman who was stabbed multiple times in an alleged attack which killed her colleague at an Adelaide real estate office tells a court of her “fight for life”. Warning: This story contains content some readers may find distressing.

item.title: Nationals issue Ley with reunion counteroffer as deadline looms
item.description: The minor party has given the opposition leader terms that one Nationals MP said they did "not expect" would be acceptable in what has been described as a bid to push out her self-imposed deadline.

item.title: Victoria and Queensland lose 17 wickets on day one of MCG Sheffield Shield game
item.description: After the two-day Ashes Test raised eyebrows over the MCG pitch, Queensland and Victoria are on track for another swift finish after 17 wickets on day one of their Sheffield Shield clash.

item.title: Bondi Junction inquest saw recommendation for supported housing for homeless, some are already benefitting
item.description: An inquest into the Bondi Junction stabbing has recommended that the NSW government support long-term accommodation for homeless people experiencing mental health issues. It's a model that is already finding success.

item.title: Porsches, Maserati allegedly stolen from Melbourne homes during overnight crime spree
item.description: Four young men are charged after allegedly stealing three luxury vehicles from homes across Melbourne on Thursday morning.

item.title: Diamonds defeat Jamaica in first netball Test match in Adelaide
item.description: The Diamonds made a flying start with the initial six goals in a comprehensive 72-41 victory at the Adelaide Entertainment Centre.

item.title: Russian captain of cargo ship Solong jailed over fatal North Sea collision
item.description: A judge describes Vladimir Motin as "an accident waiting to happen" as he hands the Russian national a six-year jail term.

item.title: New study reveals how stressful footy fandom can be
item.description: A new study reveals how much high-stakes sporting events can get the heart pumping by strapping trackers to over 200 German football fans.

item.title: Valentino Guseli gets snowboard big air wildcard, leaps into final at Milano Cortina 2026 Winter Olympics
item.description: Valentino Guseli only found out he had been added to the big air field a couple of hours before the competition start after a rival's injury, but still found a way to make it to the final.

item.title: Epstein files reveal the men who looked away after women had spoken up
item.description: The millions of pages of documents related to the late convicted sex offender Jeffrey Epstein have shone a light on how many influential men were ready to disregard the experiences of countless women.

item.title: Positive spin from Liberal leader as retiring MP Sam Groth forces Nepean by-election
item.description: When retiring first-term Liberal Sam Groth told his leader he was quitting politics, forcing a by-election, Jess Wilson didn't try to talk him out of it.

item.title: Today in history, February 6: The Manchester United team that perished in the Munich air disaster of 1958
item.description: On a snowy February afternoon in 1958, the football team that many were calling the greatest that Britain had ever produced stopped to refuel at Munich Airport. The plane would never take off, and the Flowers of Manchester would take years to bloom again.

item.title: Prime Minister Anthony Albanese signs security treaty with Indonesia
item.description: Prime Minister Anthony Albanese has travelled to Jakarta to sign the treaty, which the Australian government calls the "biggest step" the countries have taken together in 30 years.

item.title: Former attorney-general Mark Dreyfus warned anti-corruption chief to 'manage' or 'avoid' conflicts
item.description: A letter from Mark Dreyfus to Paul Brereton provides new insight into the expectations set for the inaugural chief of the anti-corruption watchdog.

item.title: Effect of capital gains tax changes on housing affordability likely depends on design
item.description: Labor has not ruled out changes to the capital gains tax discount but wants any tax changes to improve housing affordability.

item.description: Police declared the disappearance of Gus Lamont a major crime due to "a number of inconsistencies and discrepancies" emerging during the four-month investigation.

item.description: As police probe what led to the deadliest terror attack on Australian soil in December, radicalisation researchers and a former Islamic State group supporter have shed light on how people are recruited.

item.description: The World Anti-Doping Agency will investigate bizarre claims in German newspaper Bild that ski jumpers are injecting substances into their penises to aid aerodynamics — and other stories from the Winter Olympics a day out from the opening ceremony.

item.description: The US is urging dozens of countries to follow Australia's lead and sign on to a plan to stop relying on China for the critical minerals used in modern technology.

item.title: After the ICE shooting of Renee Nicole Good in Minneapolis, a week of chaos unfolds

item.description: When Israel's president lands in Australia this weekend, he can expect an official red carpet treatment. But he will be all too aware of the controversy his visit is generating.

item.description: They're one of Australia's most revered heavy acts. And arguably the most patient. Karnivool unpack the 13-year journey to their new album, In Verses.

item.description: The Nationals have proposed spending another two weeks in exile from the frontbench rather than address the Liberals' non-negotiable conditions for a Coalition reunion.

item.description: The court heard the posts included phrases such as "I want your head on a block Albo" and "I want permission to claim your head".

item.description: A Queensland not-for-profit mental health clinic that delivers novel therapies such as ketamine and psilocybin is expanding its services.

item.description: The Bureau of Meteorology says Tropical Cyclone Mitchell has a high chance of forming into a category two system, bringing destructive winds and heavy rain to northern WA.

item.description: The man accused of a one-punch attack on former Labor strategist Tim Picton, who died in hospital last month, has his charge upgraded to manslaughter.

item.title: Premier Chris Minns says Newcastle Writers Festival 'crazy' to invite author Randa Abdel-Fattah
item.description: The festival's director said Dr Abdel-Fattah was invited in August last year and denied the state government pressured her to remove the writer.

item.description: WA children's author Craig Silvey gets his bail conditions altered by a Perth court after complaining of "significant media attention" since being charged with child exploitation offences.

item.description: Australian freestyle skier Daisy Thomas, who is competing at the 2026 Milano Cortina Winter Olympic Games without an ACL, suffers a heavy fall in slopestyle training and has withdrawn from the event to focus on big air.

item.title: US accuses China of secret nuclear testing as Washington calls for Beijing to be part of new arms deal
item.description: The claim comes as the US calls for China to be involved in a new deal limiting the use of nuclear weapons, after the New START deal expired this week.

item.title: Donald Trump shares, then deletes, then refuses to apologise for posting video depicting Obamas as monkeys
item.description: The video was part of a late-night posting spree centred on debunked conspiracy theories linked to the 2020 US election, which the president has falsely claimed was stolen from him.

item.title: Albanese's invitation to Herzog is a shift in his approach to Israel
item.description: Unravelling the threads of antisemitism and anti-Israeli sentiment will require both more political courage and more community tolerance than we have seen to date.

item.title: Budget reform is back as Labor shapes second term agenda
item.description: As the opposition and government wrestled in the hay barn over who's to blame for this week's Reserve Bank interest rate increase, there's a much bigger story unfolding in the wings.

item.title: 'Another world is possible': Calls for unity at Winter Olympics opening
item.description: The 2026 Milano Cortina Winter Olympics are here, launched in an historic opening ceremony held in a number of Italian locations simultaneously.

item.title: Former ambassador Ian Kemish writes about Europe's 'forgotten' war in debut novel Two Islands
item.description: Former ambassador Ian Kemish draws on his 25-year diplomatic career in his debut novel, Two Islands, set against the backdrop of the Balkan War.

item.title: ABC 50/50 quiz: This week we're testing your knowledge of Gladiator, James Bond and your right to party
item.description: Every question has only two options: One is right and the other is wrong. You have an even chance of guessing correctly each time.

item.title: British PM Sir Keir Starmer pressured to resign amid fallout of Peter Mandelson's ties to Jeffrey Epstein
item.description: Sir Keir Starmer led Labour to a landslide election victory two years ago, but in the past week, things have unravelled for the British prime minister. What went wrong?

item.title: Elders say truth-telling 'critical' to combatting racism after alleged terror attack
item.description: For Noongar Elders, the alleged attack on Boorloo/Perth is viewed against the background of a long history of violence. They are calling for a truth-telling commission to heal deep scars and help to combat racism.

item.title: ICC T20 World Cup: Everything you need to know and who to support as a neutral cricket fan
item.description: As another T20 World Cup sneaks up on us, here's everything you need to know about the tournament, including a guide on how to pick which team to support, depending on your needs.

item.title: Inside the 'textbook' search for Gus Lamont
item.description: A retired police officer who helped pioneer search guidelines used during the investigation into the disappearance of Gus Lamont, praises the efforts to find the missing boy and expresses support for the detectives' conclusions.

item.title: Vaibhav Sooryavanshi, India's 14-year-old batting prodigy, breaks records in Under-19 World Cup final
item.description: The 14-year-old prodigy Vaibhav Sooryavanshi breaks Alyssa Healy's record with the highest score ever in a World Cup final to power India to the global under-19 crown.

item.title: Weather sees nationwide soaking as tropical humidity reaches south-east Australia
item.description: Almost every corner of Australia will pick up rain during the next seven days, including heavy falls and pockets of flooding in multiple states.

item.title: Adelaide Festival leader Julian Hobba reflects on Writers' Week controversy
item.description: As Adelaide Writers' Week went up in flames, Julian Hobba contemplated resigning as Adelaide Festival's executive director. He now says "we needed to trust the judgement" of the literary event's former leader, Louise Adler.

item.title: Collision sport Run Nation Championship in Sydney sells 5,000 tickets despite head injury concerns
item.description: The Run Nation Championship will see two athletes run at each other, in a sport criticised for its head injury risks. Organisers argue the championship has been professionalised, and will grow to be as big as boxing.

item.title: Ex-Shincheonji members accuse church of pressure to make large donations
item.description: Former members of Christian fringe group Shincheonji have alleged financial abuse by the religious organisation.

item.title: Golden bandicoot numbers triple at Newhaven Wildlife Sanctuary in Central Australia
item.description: A population of threatened golden bandicoots is booming at Newhaven Wildlife Sanctuary, north-west of Alice Springs.

item.title: Meringandan collector sells vintage tractors, trucks, machines on Queensland farm
item.description: As the last man standing, 78-year-old cattleman Mervyn has parted with his collection of tractors and utes, pledging his estate to charity.

item.title: Epstein files reaffirm even a conviction doesn't taint 'good bloke' status
item.description: The rich and powerful were all too happy to stay connected to Jeffrey Epstein until it became the less convenient option.

item.title: Canberra man who murdered ex-wife in kitchen believed he had been badly treated, court hears
item.description: Disturbing new details emerge about the 2023 stabbing death of a woman in her Bruce home as her former partner faces sentencing for her murder in the ACT Supreme Court.

item.title: How a cheating Brisbane socialite orchestrated her high-flying husband’s 1953 murder in a Hamilton mansion
item.description: The brutal killing of a high-flying hotelier in his Brisbane mansion led to decades of rumour, myth and speculation about what unfolded on that fateful night.

item.title: ‘Absolutely horrified’: Community left in the dark about PFAS contamination
item.description: For 25 years this waterway was polluted with toxic "forever chemicals". It was only disconnected from a major drinking supply 18 months ago.

item.description: One of three people who died in a light plane crash south of Adelaide has been identified as an experienced pilot.

item.title: Australian athletes to watch at the 2026 Milano Cortina Winter Olympic Games
item.description: Australia is taking its strongest ever team to the Winter Olympics in 2026, with a number of genuine medal chances. Here's a handful of the stars you need to pay attention to.

item.title: Easy homemade granola that will last you weeks - ABC News
item.description: When it comes to batch cooking, don't forget breakfast. This granola can make mornings easier and will last weeks.

item.title: Iran's mysterious Pickaxe Mountain a 'candidate' for new nuclear activities
item.description: Since the US bombed Iran's key nuclear sites last year, analysts say work has increased at a secret underground facility that could be used to restart Tehran's nuclear program.

item.description: Nancy Guthrie was last seen alive when a relative dropped her outside her Tucson home after a family games night. The 84-year-old grandmother has now been missing for a week.

item.title: Lithium-ion battery fires prompt new waste collection program in North Queensland
item.description: Authorities say crews responded to 260 lithium-ion battery fires in Queensland last year. A new waste collection program in the state's north aims to prevent them.

item.title: What is the AIN at the 2026 Milano Cortina Winter Olympics? Why Russian and Belarusian athletes are allowed to compete in Italy
item.description: The Winter Olympics of Milano Cortina 2026 is another where Russian and Belarusian athletes will be largely absent, although there are a handful competing as individual neutral athletes.

item.title: Trump endorses Prime Minister Sanae Takaichi ahead of Japan's election
item.description: One of Sanae Takaichi's first engagements after she was elevated to prime minister in October was to host Donald Trump in Tokyo.

item.description: Follow the latest headlines from ABC News, Australia's most trusted media source, with live events, audio and on-demand video from the national broadcaster.

item.title: Nine-year-old Jackson Mackay deadlifts into the record books
item.description: In January, the Sunshine Coast boy claimed a world record with an 80-kilogram deadlift, beating the previous record of 72 kilograms.

item.title: Family from Netherlands calls for change after 27yo dies of suspected heatstroke in remote WA
item.description: Tiffani Phelps de Wildt died after collapsing on a remote station in WA's north. Her family says, had they known the risks, they would have tried to stop her from going out in the heat.

item.title: Winter Olympics 2026 opening ceremony quick hits: Mariah Carey and Valentino Rossi ignite an historic evening as Snoop Dogg makes an appearance
item.description: Athletes parade across Italy, Mariah Carey ignites a historic evening, and 'Coach Snoop' makes an appearance at the curling. Here are the quick hits from the Milano Cortina Winter Olympics opening ceremony.

item.title: A 2026 Winter Olympics opening ceremony message of harmony and peace, rammed into a world of division
item.description: As the Milano Cortina 2026 Winter Olympics Opening ceremony pleads a message of peace, the world outside the Olympic bubble burns.

item.description: The remarkable story of Austin Appelbee's marathon swim for help went around the world, so why did it spark such an emotional reaction?

item.description: Track the path of Tropical Cyclone Mitchell and monitor wind speeds as the system approaches the Pilbara coast.

item.title: Living School's innovative learning model prompts Victorian family to move to Lismore
item.description: A family from Torquay, Victoria, was so impressed by a school's progressive approach that they relocated to Lismore, 1,500 kilometres away in New South Wales, to enrol their children.

item.title: Woman was asleep when car crashed into house in Perth suburb of Rivervale, killing her
item.description: A woman who had been in Perth to visit family was asleep when a car crashed into an inner-city home, killing her, late on Friday night.

item.title: Winter Olympics 2026 quick guide: What to watch on Day 1, Saturday, February 7
item.description: Find out what's on at the Winter Olympics in Milan today.

item.title: Fifth-generation Gunnedah butcher retires, ending 150-year Etheridge family legacy
item.description: Gunnedah butcher Bernard Etheridge has hung up the knives, marking the end of an era for the Etheridge family, which has worked in the meat industry for more than 150 years.

item.title: Accused militant in deadly 2012 Benghazi attack on US compound taken into custody in United States
item.description: Zubayar Al-Bakoush, 58, has been wanted by the United States for more than a decade for his alleged role in the attack, which killed four Americans, including the US ambassador to Libya.

item.title: Police given additional powers as NSW premier calls for calm during Israeli presidential visit
item.description: NSW Premier Chris Minns has told demonstrators planning to protest Israel President Isaac Herzog's visit to Sydney that there should be "no clashes or violence".

item.title: Donald Trump's rare backdown on racist Obama post shows even the 'Teflon president' has limits
item.description: Donald Trump has, until now, thrived in controversy. But the US president has now done something that a year ago would have been unthinkable: deleted a social media post.

item.title: The Mark of Cain lead singer on a lifetime masking the truth
item.description: The lead singer of legendary Adelaide rockers The Mark of Cain this week announced she was transgender, but it comes after nearly 60 years of hiding the truth from everyone.

item.title: US prosecutors seek 46-month sentence for conspiracy theorist linked to Wieambilla killers
item.description: US prosecutors are seeking a sentence of almost four years for a conspiracy theorist linked to the trio behind the Wieambilla shooting.

item.title: Pregnant women in WA's Kimberley face big distances to hospital and high rates of heart condition, diabetes
item.description: Pregnant women in WA's Kimberley experience high rates of preventable health conditions, hours of travel to receive basic care and limited support.

item.title: Thailand election stakes are high as progressives mount new challenge against establishment
item.description: As Thailand prepares to head to the polls, voters remain wary that in their version of democracy, the party they vote for is not always the one that takes power.

item.title: What you need to know about skiing in Japan and how to keep yourself safe on the slopes
item.description: Australians flock to Japan each year to take advantage of its unique and plentiful snow, but it's not just the travel costs that are mounting.

item.title: Collectors snap up Royal Australian Mint's Queen Elizabeth II coins, despite criticism
item.description: The portrait of Queen Elizabeth on two coins released by the Royal Australian Mint has drawn criticism, despite proving popular with collectors.

item.title: Luigi Mangione speaks out against prospect of back-to-back trials over Brian Thompson's killing
item.description: Accused killer has spoken out in court against the prospect of back-to-back trials over the shooting of UnitedHealthcare CEO Brian Thompson, telling a judge "it's the same trial twice".

item.title: Report finds two thirds of tip-offs about children in harm in NSW not investigated
item.description: In one uninvestigated case a man was convicted of sexually abusing a minor a year after an uninvestigated report was made to the department.

item.title: Mayor of flood-hit Daly region accuses governments of inaction over long-term planning
item.description: The Northern Territory and federal governments are being accused of failing to plan long term to protect Indigenous communities in the Victoria Daly region.

item.title: Latest Epstein files documents reveal links to multiple monarchies
item.description: The latest release of the so-called Epstein files has revealed the convicted child sex offender was in contact with members of — and people close to — monarchies across Europe and the Middle East.

item.title: What our teeth reveal about the growing gap between rich and poor
item.description: Teeth are one of the most visible markers of poverty: structural circumstances that are individually borne.

item.title: Jewish leader condemns graffiti attack on Andrew Hastie's office in Mandurah
item.description: Police are investigating a derogatory slur spray-painted on federal MP Andrew Hastie's electorate office in Western Australia.

item.title: Why Wests Tigers hopeful Pat Herbert jumped off an excavator and into an NRL pre-season
item.description: After three years away from first grade, Pat Herbert was ready to get on with the rest of his life but a call from Wests Tigers got him off the job site and into an NRL pre-season.

item.title: Colorado funeral home owner sentenced over nearly 200 counts of corpse abuse
item.description: A funeral home owner who stashed 189 decomposing bodies in a building over four years and gave grieving families fake ashes has been sentenced to 40 years in prison.

item.title: Thousands of Queensland kids 'put at risk' after IT system failure
item.description: Queensland's child safety minister says she was not briefed about issues with a botched IT system that potentially put kids at risk.

item.description: Almost 300 people from Daly River have been evacuated to Darwin, with just a handful of residents staying behind.

item.title: Karratha residents warned to prepare for 200km/h winds as Tropical Cyclone Mitchell intensifies
item.description: While avoiding a direct hit, Karratha is still expected to feel the force of the category three cyclone as it tracks along the Pilbara coast tonight.

item.title: Live: Nightmare start for Gu after crash in opening run of slopestyle qualifiers
item.description: Two-time gold medallist Eileen Gu is in action in the women's slopestyle qualifiers before Valentino Guseli competes in the final round of the Big Air. Follow live.
